channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Older Workers Can Now Supersize Their 401(k) Savings
item.description: The new super catch-up rule is part of the inflation adjustments to retirement account limits announced Friday.

item.title: Gold Falls Late in Trading
item.description: Front-month gold futures finished the day down 0.1% as the precious metal lost momentum throughout the day.

item.title: Amazon shares pop on earnings beat, cloud growth
item.description: The company's cloud and advertising units showed strong growth.

item.title: Dow, Nasdaq Rally After Tech Selloff
item.description: U.S. stocks posted solid gains, led by Intel and Amazon.com, and also reacting to the latest jobs report, which boosted confidence in more Fed interes...

item.title: Exxon beats earnings estimates, increases fourth-quarter dividend
item.description: Exxon's stock rose in early trading after beating earnings expectations.

item.title: The Trump Betting Whale Speaks Out: 'I Have Absolutely No Political Agenda'
item.description: A self-described French trader says he bet more than $30 million on the U.S. election after analyzing polls.

item.title: Chevron beats earnings expectations, returns more than $7 billion to shareholders
item.description: Chevron's stock is largely flat for the year, underperforming the S&P 500 energy sector which has gained more than 6%.

item.title: Amazon shares jump 7%, approach record after earnings beat
item.description: Amazon's latest upbeat results were driven by growth in cloud and digital advertising.

item.title: You Bought Blockbuster I Bonds. Here's What to Do With Them Now.
item.description: The millions of people who bought I bonds when inflation peaked have a decision to make: Hold them, or redeem them and buy new ones.

item.title: Coterra Energy posted a mixed quarter, but delivered beats where it matters most
item.description: Once again, management's strict adherence to cost discipline meant strong earnings and free cash flow generation.
